thread.title: Post your questions for Father Bob Maguire
thread.title_full: Post your questions for Father Bob Maguire

author: Guardian Staff
title: Post your questions for Father Bob Maguire
text:
Catholicism Post your questions for Father Bob Maguire 
He’s a social justice warrior, agony uncle and that shouty guy from Triple J: here’s your chance to ask anything you want of Australia’s maverick Catholic priest Father Bob Maguire, the ‘patron saint of the unloved and unlovely’. Photograph: Julian Smith/AAP View more sharing options Close Monday 6 February 2017 22.32 GMT 
Father Bob Maguire – Australia’s best-known maverick Catholic priest – is a man known for practising what he preaches. A self-described “patron saint of the unloved and unlovely”, he was a parish priest in South Melbourne for nearly 40 years and the co-host of Sunday Night Safran on Triple J for a decade. 
While the 82-year-old has since retired from these roles, he remains at the helm of the Father Bob Foundation, which feeds about 600 of Melbourne’s homeless a week, supports at-risk children and advocates for the poor. He recently said his goal for 2017 was to help “tackle sadness”. 
Ahead of his panel appearance at the Womadelaide festival on 13 March, where he will be discussing religion’s role in environmental responsibility, Guardian Australia will be meeting up with Father Bob to ask him your questions on any topic you fancy – be it priestly, personal or political. We’ll be recording his responses for a one-off podcast. Post your question here: Topics
